meanings.sent1: The small dog was the twitchiest of all, always jumping at sudden noises.
meanings.sent2: She felt the twitchiest when waiting for the exam results.
meanings.sent3: The twitchiest squirrel in the park kept darting around, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His twitchiest movements resembled a scared rabbit trying to escape.
meanings.sent5: The twitchiest moments for her were during thunderstorms, when every sound made her jump.

meanings.definition: Twitchiest (adverb): in a nervous or jumpy manner
meanings.sent1: She looked around twitchiest, expecting something to startle her.
meanings.sent2: The cat moved twitchiest when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: He walked twitchiest after watching a scary movie, imagining monsters around every corner.
meanings.sent4: The leaves rustled in the wind, making the trees sway twitchiest.
meanings.sent5: The children played tag, running around twitchiest, full of energy and excitement.

meanings.definition: Twitchiest (noun): the state of being extremely nervous or jumpy
meanings.sent1: His constant twitchiest made it hard for him to relax in social situations.
meanings.sent2: The twitchiest of the students was always on edge, ready to react to any sudden movement.
meanings.sent3: The twitchiest of the group was the first to notice the hidden surprise, jumping with excitement.
meanings.sent4: In the dark forest, the twitchiest was the feeling of being watched by unseen eyes.
meanings.sent5: The twitchiest of moments was when the lights flickered, casting eerie shadows on the walls.
